data.title: Piecewise Proverbs
data.solution:
pieces = {}
endings = set()
for _ in range(int(input())):
    fragment = input().split()
    pieces[fragment[0]] = fragment
    endings.add(fragment[-1])

start = (set(pieces) - endings).pop()
result = [pieces[start][0]]
while pieces:
    node = result[-1]
    result += pieces[node][1:]
    del pieces[node]
print(' '.join(result))
data.statement: A <<common saying>> has been broken up into [[N]] sentence <<fragments>>, where the last word of each [[fragment]] is <<repeated>> as the first word in the next. These fragments are <<scrambled>>! Reconstruct the [[sentence]], which starts with a capital letter and ends with a period.

data.constraints:
1 < [[N]] < 10
There are exactly [[N]] - 1 matching  pairs among first and last words.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read fragment:string(25)
write sentence
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of fragments
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> A string [[fragment]] consisting of 2 or more words

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A common saying has been broken up into N sentence fragments, where the last word of each fragment is repeated as the first word in the next. These fragments are scrambled! Reconstruct the sentence, which starts with a capital letter and ends with a period.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of fragments
Next N lines: A string fragment consisting of 2 or more words
Output
Line 1: The reconstructed sentence
Constraints
1 < N < 10
There are exactly N - 1 matching pairs among first and last words.
Example
Input
3
A picture is worth
worth a thousand
thousand words.
Output
A picture is worth a thousand words.
